intro: Thalictrum sphaerospermum, commonly known as the globular meadow-rue, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a short growing season. Its unique spherical seed heads are a distinguishing feature, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Thalictrum sphaerospermum is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its aesthetic appeal in alpine landscapes.
